intro: Pleurospermum lithuanicum, commonly known as Lithuanian pleurospermum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. It is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
